availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky, Confederate guerilla. Kentucky native. Son of Drucilla Menefee. Served in the Mexican-American War. Resident of Hickory County, Missouri, in 1850. Law student in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Referred to as colonel by the provisional government of the State of Kentucky at the convention held at Russelville, Kentucky, in November 1861. Adviser to the provisional government on the pro-Confederate sentiment in eastern Kentucky at the convention held at Russelville in November 1861. Scout for General Humphrey Marshall (C.S.A.) in 1862. Leader of a Confederate guerrilla unit in eastern Kentucky in 1862. Arrested by Confederate authorities on murder charges in Wise County, Virginia, in April 1863.

ab.bibl:
Brian D. McKnight, Contested Borderland: The Civil War in Appalachian Kentucky and Virginia (University Press of Kentucky, 2006), pp. 151-153.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Hickory County, District 37, p. 62B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Kentucky, District 1, p. 755.
KYR-0004-033-0011.
